column5: My wife is Dutch and she trys to make me eat those damned things whenever I have a sore throat. But for me it's a couple sammages, jerky, and a 24 Canadian.
Its all about good eats !!!! lets try this again ....good sandwitches

I gotta agree with Tony...G'Weeches made by Meely...  Unless he is BBQing eh Lew?  DAD's cookies compliments of Crappieperchhunter...  Nature Valley "Sweet and Salty" almond bars make a nice, light snack...  Mostly a couple of bottles of water is enough 'till I get back home...
Dropies and Hopjes. Mmmmmmm... maybe a few rusks with some well aged Gouda and Shaved Horse meat.  Nothing Better   Gerritt
I usually bring a canadian/u.s. style military ration    and you may ask were to get these, well a few make it home with the guys and they are really handy for camping or hiking
NoS Energy drink if I'm driving.  Beers if I'm not.  Smokes.  Jerky.  Pepperoni's.  Tums, lots of them.
Gweetches.  Not as good as Meely's  but damn fine nonetheless.  Pannini, porchetta, provolone, and some of that garlicky mustard from Kozlick's.
definately the peperonni sticks and some pepsi, and a few bottles of water. also like to have a few cigars while fishing
Did anyone else read through this thread and find themselves getting REAL hungry? Its like I haven't eaten in a monthLOL
Well I have to second douG's Gweetches and Appo Juice... Amazing!.. if you are blessed enough to have one.... run @ the chance... phenomenal!   G
I hurled a little bit in the back of my mouth when i read what they were!
Two words ... Miss Vickies !

Well I have this weakeness for those snieders kids luncheon thingy's.  Crackers with sliced turkey and white cheddar my son gets the kit kat.  Buddy Kenny makes this out of a world sandwich.  Pringles,Miss vickies,Beef Jerky and an ice cold pepsi.  MTP
Cut up apples and prunes.....but make sure you have a head on board!
Trail mix and Iced Tea
monster energy drink and all dressed chips!!
Jeebus, How the hell do ya keep that slim figure while eating all that stuff.
I usually have a bag of Roasted Almonds, water, Some smoked tuna, Practially live off that stuff. I generally eat stuff that does not make me have to go to shore behind some tree.
Usually just a bunch of sandwiches and a few litres of water for me.

LOL , I know where your coming from....I did a bear squat last week in the bush after eating a french crueller from Timmies on the way down.....I was laughing at it when I turned around and saw it steaming ...BAAAH

Lunchables!! { I eat my kids lunches on the weekends} Beef Jerky  .....  Pepsi..&  Hortons'  whatever my wife decides to pack for me..  But when I fish a tourney  my partner and I split on a bucket of chicken or we order pizza the night before and eat it cold on  T   day .

You got that right just packed my snack for tomorrow's day on the tribs and I had to go out to food basics to replenish the supply of hot pepperoni....  I usually take a couple of handfuls of almonds and an apple to have with my morning coffee on the way. For when I get back to the car or lunch time I usually take a couple of cans of pop. Some presliced marble cheese, pepperettes and another apple. (sucks not being able to sandwiches anymore due to a gluten allergy)  Yeah I have trouble eating stuff with dead bits from bait and fish on my hands too so that is why I wrap everything in saran or a paper towel so I can eat it... being in the food industry I just have to wash my hands before I can eat. I tried that waterless hand santizer one time that was worse tasting than the crud on my hands, so never again.
I think u mean sangweches......... what about the soppressatta and parmigiano reggiano lol
A dozen barley sandwiches is all I need.  Oh...a bag of sunflower seeds is good to have too.
The greatest fishing snack of alltime!! http://www.combos.com/  They make for good carp bait as well
damn right! havn't had those for years!

Water, 2 pack of mars bars and if I'm going out all day and don't want to spend too much I'll boil some water and dunk some Juicy Jumbos in a thermos. Come lunchtime, they're good to go!  I'll go fishing with jdmls and lakeshore anytime! Good eats, I'll prepare some good Sangwitches too if I have the time.  Under no circumstance is banana bread or any banana-type product allowed on my boat.
Learn to love sushi. Then you won't have to be so fussy.  JF
When I'm trib fishing I forget to eat!  I usually bring a sandwich and lots of water on the tribs.  On a boat, it's sandwiches, chips and gatorade!

Whatever single malt is in the flask, beer is in the cooler, berry grows on shore, or animal crosses my path.   What, did you think I was going to say cranberry juice, Perrier, prunes and pate like the rest of you freaks.   Seriously though, I'd take a couple from the top and maybe some licorice, chocolate or cookies or something.  That'll have to change though unless I start brushing with Sensodyne.  Tuna sandwiches loaded with pepper too and some cheese.  If it's sunny then I don't need much but agua and the rich Vit D in the rays man.
You got that right!!! Those kind of shenanigans can get you keel-hauled on my boat!!!
I was eating banana bread and actually had it in my reel hand when I landed my personal best pike.  TAKE THAT!!!! hahaha

I was eating banana chips when I caught my PB laker on Lake Ontario, followed shortly after by my PB Brown, So take that too  I also like to take super nibs, jerky of course, rice crispie squares and diet coke or water.  Joey
If y'all want to suffer the banana boat curse with the deadly Black Tarantula... be my guest!  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6pOvnPdpNu0...feature=related
Pate' and potted meat double as a damn fine Catfish bait!!!
Dropies!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (salted licorice)  (If you're not Dutch, you're not.........)

If I'm out for more then 3-4 hours, my first stop (even before the tackle shop or gas) is to pick up a bag of chips (usually crunchy cheetos), a snickers bar, and a big bottle of gatorade....this keeps me happy for a full 8 hours if need be!!
The breakfast of champions, a pack of smokes and a can of Coke!
I cant tell you how many times I have thrown my handful of cheetos out of the boat cause I hook a fish and have no where to put em... I think they're good luck that way.

Call me a wimp, but I can't snack on things if I have slime/blood/worm guts on my hands without the ability to properly wash them.  So I tend to bring snacks on the boat that i can eat through a wrapper or bag, like a granola bar.  But that's just me...  What kind of snacks are on OFC's "must have" list to bring on the water to keep their energy up?

Banana Bread granola squares - damn I'm addicted to those.  I'll bring along a couple apples as well usually and some water.  Oh and not on the boat but I have to get my Bacinator on the way home - damn you Wendys!
BEEF JERKY!!
Pack of Piller's Pepperoni -  Hot
I'll second JERKY !!! ......plus Gatorade, and a fresh pack of Rolaids.   Hookset.
Mars bar and a Rockstar energy drink
homemade deer jerky and ice cold coors light for me(if not driving)  i also like some saltine crackers and brick cheese.   jason
Sub in crackers for loaf of fresh bread and I will ditto that comment.
David's Sunflower seeds. I can go three days on them but they do make a mess if the wind is blowing in your face

Peanut M&M's preferably the Oger "Shrek" sized ones if you can still find them.....and sweet and spicy beef jerkey. Generally a few canned beverages from the store with the big orange sign come along for the trip as well!
Nutra Grain Bars Dried Crannberrys Gatorade Joe Louis 1 lb Kielbasa
I'll add some Doritos to the list.....
Brew. I shore fish mostly.

Beenie Weenies, Cheetos, double Mounds bar, Pepsi, and water... or canned Sardines in mustard sauce with saltines and sno-balls snack cakes (the white ones)  If Ol' Yeller goes we do the picnic thing with KFC and potato salad because she don't like no Beenie Weenies or Sardines in mustard sauce
I'll second the sunflower seeds!!!  man they are addictive!!
When did home depot start selling drinks??
I second these pepperoni sticks or whatever other spicy ones I can find at the farmers markets.
It's a toss up for me, jerky (beef or pork or even sometime turkey) or the easy route of Piller's hot pepperoni. Dang, now I'm getting hungry.
3 litres of water!  no joke.  sometimes the wife is kind enough to make me a sandwhich too  cheers!
Subway BMT sub samich, foot long. Breakfast, lunch, dinner.
snickers and pepsi for me
Homemade jerky, sandwiches, chips, lots of water and occasionally a couple beers!
Home made prosciutto, or capicola.  Cheese and some soft italian bread.
Venison jerky all the way(depending how the hunt went) , and maybe a protein bar or two. RF

on the boat.....start off with fresh pot of expresso and a couple hours later we jit some mortadella / hot giardera sandwhiches.....opener I pack about 10 nice paninno's with all kind of different cold cut combo's with a splash of bomba !!!
